info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 3:26AM CDT until March 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Nueces River Near Bluntzer affecting Jim Wells, Nueces and San Patricio Counties.
For the Nueces River...including Cotulla, Tilden, Three Rivers, Mathis, Bluntzer, Calallen...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast, though heavy rainfall could still lead to minor flooding.
* WHERE...Nueces River near Bluntzer.
* WHEN...From early this morning to Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Overbank conditions occur. Flow approaches the lowest residential areas downstream above Calallen. At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs. Sustained flow at this rate floods homes downstream near Calallen.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. Heavy rainfall could lead to a crest as high as 18 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 06/05/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Jim Wells, TX; Nueces, TX; San Patricio, TX
